t.t-elif: o and 'company_id' in o and o.company_id.sudo()

div.div: Proposal for Application Security Audit of

tr.td: SecurEyes hereby submits the techno commercial proposal for the application security audit of

SecurEyes Techno Services Pvt. Ltd.

p.p:
SecurEyes is to conduct the security audit of
. The application security audit conducted by SecurEyes is an initiative to safeguard against online & offline threats that allow attackers to compromise the security of applications. SecurEyes proposes consulting charges, detailed methodologies and other credentials towards the application security audit.

An application security audit conducted by SecurEyes is a method of evaluating the security of an online/offline application by simulating attacks by a malicious hacker. The testing is conducted under a controlled environment, with details being mutually agreed between the customer and SecurEyes. The process involves an active analysis of the system for any weaknesses, technical flaws or vulnerabilities that may lead to application compromise.

SecurEyes leverages the varied expertise of its team, industry standards and advanced techniques to offer a high-end application security review capable of detecting even very remote vulnerabilities in the target application
The following are some of the highlights of SecurEyes that stand as an advantage, in choosing SecurEyes as the preferred services partner for this project.

p.b: 1.2.1 Similar work performed in the Govt. & Defense Sectors

tr.td: National Informatics Centre (Department of Electronics & Information Technology), CGO Complex, New Delhi
CERT-In (Department of Information Technology), New Delhi
Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, New Delhi
National Informatics Centre Services nc. (Ministry of Communications & Information Technology), New Delhi
Directorate General of Civil Aviation, New Delhi
Railway Recruitment Board, Bangalore Railway Recruitment Board, Bangalore Railway Recruitment Board, Thiruvananthapuram
Karnataka State Beverages Corporation Limited, Bangalore
Bureau of Pharmacy PSUs of India (BPPI), New Delhi
Kerala Medical Services Corporation Ltd, Thiruvananthapuram
Naval Ship Repair Yard, Port Blair

p.p: Following activities are proposed to be included in the project scope:

Phase-1: Application Security Audit of
:

details
((
Number of Login Modules:
Number of Modules:
Total Number of Pages:
Number of Dynamic pages:
Number of Application Roles:
Is CMS present:
Is payment gateway present:
))

Phase-2:
rounds of Re-Audit/Compliance check to check the closure of the reported observations.

The following details are required from the execution of various project activities:
Access URLS of applications.
Remote connection for access in the webserver applications.
Documentation and walkthrough for the applications will be provided to the team for understanding the various functionalities.
A single point of contact will be assigned for the application and if needed interviews will be scheduled with such individuals.
All the modules in the application shall be functional. Any non-functional modules will be omitted from the testing and accordingly documented.
Enough context specific data will be included in the application roles and users which are provided for testing. Where data is not available, the same will be documented as a limitation.
All channel encryption should be disabled for the assessment.

ol.li: Work Order
Assignment of a single point of contact for project coordination.

p.p:
The following will be the various activities from SecurEyes:
Conducting the 1 st level security audit of the web applications
Submission of Web application security audit reports along with recommendations. The development team needs to fix the vulnerabilities as per the detailed recommendations in the reports.
Re-audits for compliance check of the applications followed by submission of the re-audit reports.

The deliverables from the SecurEyes team would include:
Phase-1: Application Audit Report for the application which will include the following
Comprehensive executive summary
Detailed Technical Report with criticality rating
Reports shall include business impact
Recommendations against each Vulnerabilities
Phase-2: Re-Audit Report for the application.

ol.li: The above prices are inclusive of taxes.
Taxes are applicable as on the date of invoicing.
The project can commence within a reasonable time, based on mutual convenience of receipt of the work order.
Payment to be made within two weeks of receipt of invoice
The above rates are valid for a period of 30 days.

Following is the payment structure for the project engagement:
% of payment after
Phase-2 activity will be initiated only after confirmation by the client towards the resolution of all vulnerabilities as reported in the phase-1 reports.

The project activity would be conducted remotely from
.
Any further re- audits chargeable on pro-rata basis.
SecurEyes has provided its services across more than 1200 global customers.

Continuously performing Application security audits for the NIC headquarters, New Delhi, for the
past 14 years for more than 14,000+ applications. Our team of consultants work with the Cyber
Security Division, NIC HQ’s, New Delhi and provide certification for applications to be hosted on
NIC servers.
SecurEyes has conducted numerous Application Security Auditing Services for Education Informatics Division,NIC, New Delhi.

SecurEyes has conducted numerous Application Security Auditing Services for
NIC, Kerala State,
Thiruvananthapuram.

SecurEyes conducted various specialized information security consulting services to the ING Bank (now a part of Kotak Bank) for past 10 years. We have provided application security penetration testing, network security penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, architecture design consulting, training, etc. for ING.
SecurEyes is the preferred security partner for multiple banks in India & Middle-East
Experienced and certified application security auditors
Turn-around time for re-audits is very fast
Recommendations aim at easy to implement mitigating controls from a business perspective

Our continuous research, paper publications, development of security tools and communication
within the security community have enabled us to be fully aware of the challenges and issues that face today’s highly sensitized business houses.
SecurEyes has provided its services across more than 1200 global customers.

p.p: Following are a few testimonials from our clients.

It was a great pleasure working with you and your team. The support, performance and professionalism you showed assured ANB that doing business with SecurEyes was a right choice. Looking forward to working with you in future projects.
Mr. Ala Ibrahim Asali, Head of Information Security, Compliance Division, Arab National Bank

I thank you all (and of course your team who is working on the Embassy’s application audit) for your commendable and consistent efforts to pull the audit through. I will definitely recommend your company’s name for security audit related services to relevant authorities and to other GOI entities whoever approaches us for the same
Mr. Rajesh Parihar, Second Secretary, Embassy of India, Israel

SecurEyes has been providing us a variety of services in the information security area since 2006 and it has been a great experience working with them all through our engagements. Besides ethical hacking services, we have been availing security consulting services from SecurEyes since 2010. This has helped us doing a detailed analysis of security status of out applications before implementing in production.
Presentation and reporting is a key factor for customer understanding of the security paradigms and jargons. I think SecurEyes have been able to handle this effectively and their reporting formats along with detailed analysis reports are simple to go through, yet precise and clear in the status and expectations. They don’t stop with highlighting the risks but also try to help the developer teams with additional inputs for addressing those security issues. This, I feel, is a great value addition that I have not seen coming from larger companies.
Their consultants are experienced, knowledgeable and also very approachable when we really are in need of them. Personally, I see the senior management team of SecurEyes being highly customer focused and I hardly get into situations wherein I need to handle escalations from my team. On the whole, a highly professional organization and are a very good partner to work with and always confidently recommend SecurEyes to anyone
Mr. C.V.G. Prasad, Former Chief Information Officer, ING Vysya Bank (a division of Kotak Bank)

SecurEyes provides a comprehensive training on information security in an engaging manner, which is very well-received by all. It’s highly recommended for engineering teams in product security
Mr. Kiran Devaiah, Senior Manager – Product Development, RSA

SecurEyes has provided Safelight Security with expert security and training delivery services for over five years. When Safelight’s multi-national customers require in-region delivery of application security training, we are confident that SecurEyes will deliver the most highly qualified professionals. SecurEyes is a Partner in the truest sense and has proven that they can be considered an extended part of our team
Safelight, USA

I was really happy with the way the project went. It was a pleasure working with you guys. Your processes & documentation is excellent
Mr. Mark Curphey, Founding Member of OWASP & Consulting Directory, Foundstone Inc.
